posts.content:
I've been up since 4AM - Amped with excitement, maybe some nerves, AND a ton of gratitude.

We create unforgettable experiences and real relationships.

Thank you to our partnersand

The world is evolving fast, converging at the intersection of physical, digital, and mental safety.

- Physical security is about health, protection, and being prepard for anything life throws at you.

- Digital security is being reshaped by AI, tech, and the internet, changing how we live and work in ways we‚Äôve never seen.

- Mental safety focuses on mindset, business, community-building, relationships, and leveraging connections for resources.

In 2025, you can‚Äôt have one without the other. This triad of support is essential.

The stakes are higher, and this is our chance to reconnect as a country and community.

That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre shutting down an 800-acre facility this Friday...AND we will be announcing our next event in August....hint hint.

comments.commentText: Worth attending

As you‚Äôve probably seen, I‚Äôve started a new chapter supporting the Rust  space across the US here at Lawrence Harvey. With several hundred new connections over the last couple of weeks I wanted to take the opportunity to introduce/reintroduce myself to my network, and outline how I can support moving forward. So as a brief lowdown:

Ô∏è: I‚Äôve been working in Software Development recruit for around 7 years now, and supported a range of complex roles from VC to major team builds for multinational corporations.

: I‚Äôm passionate about all things community within the ecosystem, having founded multiple meet-ups & spoke at a number of conferences. I‚Äôm all for any suggestions to help the space grow and make it more accessible to anyone!

‚Äç: I‚Äôm working with an incredible team here at Lawrence Harvey, and with Rust having so many interesting capabilities across HPC, Privacy, Cybersecurity, Data and more this feels like a perfect match to be able to support people across the entire ecosystem.

So, if you‚Äôre interested in a new role within the Rust space, or you want support finding the best possible quality of candidates for your team then don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out on the details below. I‚Äôd love to speak to as many of you as possible in the next few weeks!

posts.name:
JavaScript
JavaScript
posts.content:
Sorting Numbers in JavaScript? Avoid This Mistake! 

If you‚Äôve ever tried sorting a list of numbers in JavaScript with array.sort(), you might have ended up with something like this:

 [1, 100000, 21, 30, 4]

Why does this happen?

Ô∏è JavaScript sorts numbers as if they‚Äôre text! So instead of comparing values numerically, it compares them alphabetically‚Äîlike how a dictionary works.

How to fix it?

Ô∏è To sort numbers properly, you need to tell JavaScript to treat them as actual numbers. It‚Äôs a simple tweak, but it makes all the difference.

Pro Tip: Always check how sorting functions behave, especially in different programming languages!

Have you faced funny moments like this while coding? Share them in the comments! Let‚Äôs learn (and laugh) together.

comments.commentText: If there is no comparator function is provided in the sort method. It will use the default comparator function. In the default comparator function it converts the parameters of it using toString() and then it will compare those strings. That's why........

Abinash Karmakar 
Informative! Ô∏è

Awwww this just made me remember the struggle I had the first time.

posts.name:
Sandeep Dinodiya
Sandeep Dinodiya
posts.content:
Wrapping Up the Year in Style: A Memorable Offsite Trek 

This year, our team decided to step out of our comfort zone‚Äîliterally! Instead of a conventional offsite, we embraced the challenge of a tough terrain and embarked on an adventurous trek to Tungnath and Chandrashila in the breathtaking Garhwal Himalayas.

Here are some fascinating highlights about this incredible journey:

 Tungnath Temple: The highest Shiva temple in the world, standing tall at 3,680 meters (12,073 feet).
 Chandrashila Summit:
Literally means "Moon Rock."
Perched at an impressive altitude of 3,690 meters (12,106 feet).
Offers panoramic views of the majestic Himalayas.
 Elevation Highlights:
Chopta (starting point): 2,680 meters (8,792 feet).
Tungnath: 3,680 meters (12,073 feet).
Chandrashila (highest point): 3,690 meters (12,106 feet).

This trek was not just about scaling heights‚Äîit was about disconnecting to reconnect. With no internet for three days, we truly immersed ourselves in the experience, focusing on the natural beauty, meaningful conversations, and strengthening team bonds.

‚ÄçÔ∏è What made it special?
An amazing break from work, helping us recharge and reflect.
Strengthening our team spirit and camaraderie.
Embracing challenges and making memories that will last a lifetime.
Here's to more adventures, stronger connections, and an even better year ahead! Ô∏è


.

comments.commentText: Scaling mountains, scaling minds. This trek wasn‚Äôt just about altitude; it was about the altitude of connection and growth. Culture thrives when teams step out, embrace challenges, and reconnect.  Sandeep Dinodiya
Vijender Yadav Thanks !

Sandeep Dinodiya 
Here to help you shape a thriving culture. 

Let's get started with some valuable insights.

What an incredible way to close out the year! Ô∏è Taking on such a challenging trek together not only builds stronger bonds but also reflects the kind of mindset that drives success‚Äîpushing limits, embracing discomfort, and staying connected to what matters. Experiences like these remind us that growth happens both in business and in the moments we step outside our routines.

posts.name:
Ananya Narang
Ananya Narang
posts.content:
In the past week, Swiggy has done more than what most startups fail to do in their lifetimes:

Jan 8: Snacc ‚Äì 15-minute food delivery app

Jan 9: Instamart ‚Äì Rolled out in 75+ cities, standalone app announced

Jan 9: Swiggy Serves ‚Äì 50 million meals to be distributed by 2030

Jan 10: Pyng ‚Äì Professional services marketplace

Jan 15: Swiggy Sports ‚Äì Sports and recreation vertical

While the first 3 feel natural in their respective domains, the next 2 have me thinking:

Either this is the start of a grand ecosystem play or just random shots in the dark.

If it‚Äôs the former, Swiggy might be onto something big‚Äîjust like Amazon!

Amazon went from selling books to becoming the everything store. Ecosystems, when done right, build loyalty and keep customers hooked.

One vertical feeds into another, creating a seamless experience that‚Äôs hard to leave.

But if these ventures lack focus or synergy, that‚Äôs a slippery slope.

The startup world is full of bold bets, and Swiggy‚Äôs latest moves are no exception. Time will tell if they‚Äôre building the next big thing‚Äîor just rolling the dice.

What do you think? Genius strategy or gamble?

comments.commentText: India is up for a revolutionary change and I feel it's just getting started
The way Swiggy is moving and launching new apps, I'm gonna have more Swiggy apps rather than social media apps
